DataElement.preferredName: Throat Mucosa Preoperative Imaging Abnormal or Suspicious Finding Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not an abnormal or suspicious lesion was found on preoperative imaging of the muscosal site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Throat Mucosa Preoperative Imaging Technique Abnormal Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth._Mucous membrane._Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.:Mucous membrane.

Concepts.definition: The narrow passage from the mouth to the cavity at the back of the mouth.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
